g.title: Age ≥18 years->Multiple meningiomas or young age
Multiple meningiomas or young age->Annual brain and spine MRI
g.text: Proceed with imaging regardless of result

g.title: Multiple meningiomas or young age->NF2 mutation detected
No significant family history->Multiple meningiomas or young age
No significant family history->Annual brain and spine MRI
Annual brain and spine MRI->Multiple lesions detected
Annual brain and spine MRI->Tumor growth >1.5mm/3 months
Annual brain and spine MRI->Intraventricular mass detected
NF2 mutation detected->Annual brain and spine MRI
Multiple lesions detected->Multiple meningiomas or young age
g.text: Test for NF2 and other mutations

g.title: Multiple lesions detected->Proceed to treatment planning
Proceed to treatment planning->Assess pregnancy status
Proceed to treatment planning->Improved with supportive care
Proceed to treatment planning->Assess visual symptoms
New neurological deficits->Multiple meningiomas or young age
Improved with supportive care->New neurological deficits
Improved with supportive care->Tumor growth >3mm/6 months
Improved with supportive care->Inadequate symptom control
Improved with supportive care->Monitor for response
Improved with supportive care->Disease progression on trial
Improved with supportive care->New onset seizures
Improved with supportive care->Increased edema, worsening symptoms
Not pregnant->Improved with supportive care
g.text: Poor performance status or patient preference

g.title: Not pregnant->Tumor growth >3mm/6 months
g.text: Large tumor or near critical structures

g.title: Inadequate symptom control->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
Inadequate symptom control->Increased edema, worsening symptoms
Atypical features or subtotal resection->Recurrence <3cm, good KPS
Atypical features or subtotal resection->Inadequate symptom control
Atypical features or subtotal resection->Monitor for response
Monitor for response->Multiple meningiomas or young age
Monitor for response->Improved with supportive care
Monitor for response->Tumor growth >3mm/6 months
g.text: Growth of small, previously observed lesion

g.title: Monitor for response->Disease progression on trial
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
g.text: KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment

g.title: Monitor for response->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
Monitor for response->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
Monitor for response->New lesion on follow-up imaging
Monitor for response->Reports of cognitive changes
Monitor for response->Decreased KPS or work capacity
Disease progression on trial->New neurological deficits
Disease progression on trial->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
Disease progression on trial->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
Disease progression on trial->Decreased KPS or work capacity
Disease progression on trial->Extensive disease, KPS <50
Disease progression on trial->Signs of increased ICP
Rapid growth or new aggressive features
g.text: Rapid growth or new aggressive features

g.title: Disease progression on trial->Rapid growth or new aggressive features
g.text: Rapid growth or new aggressive features

g.title: Disease progression on trial->Suspicion of malignant transformation
Disease progression on trial->Rapid neurological decline, KPS <30
Disease progression on trial->Increased edema, worsening symptoms
Disease progression on trial->Multiple enhancing nodules, CSF dissemination
Disease progression on trial->Evaluate functional status
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->Long-term stability (>5 years)
g.text: Poor performance status or multiple prior treatments

g.title: KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->New neurological deficits
g.text: If operable and good performance status

g.title: KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->Improved with supportive care
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->Recurrence <3cm, good KPS
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->Inadequate symptom control
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->If prior radiation and progression
KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment->Extensive disease, KPS <50
g.text: Poor performance status, multiple prior treatments

g.title: Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III->Monitor for response
g.text: Monitor for response and side effects

g.title: Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III->Disease progression on trial
New lesion on follow-up imaging->New neurological deficits
New lesion on follow-up imaging->Improved with supportive care
New lesion on follow-up imaging->Recurrence <3cm, good KPS
New lesion on follow-up imaging->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
Reports of cognitive changes->Improved with supportive care
Reports of cognitive changes->Monitor for response
Reports of cognitive changes->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
New onset seizures->Improved with supportive care
New onset seizures->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
Decreased KPS or work capacity->Improved with supportive care
Decreased KPS or work capacity->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
g.text: KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment

g.title: Decreased KPS or work capacity->Extensive disease, KPS <50
Decreased KPS or work capacity->Increased edema, worsening symptoms
If prior radiation and progression->Monitor for response
Extensive disease, KPS <50->KPS >40 and patient wishes aggressive treatment
Extensive disease, KPS <50->Rapid neurological decline, KPS <30
Extensive disease, KPS <50->Increased edema, worsening symptoms
Rapid growth or new aggressive features->Extensive disease, KPS <50
Rapid growth or new aggressive features->Suspicion of malignant transformation
Increased edema, worsening symptoms->Inadequate symptom control
Increased edema, worsening symptoms->Monitor for response
Increased edema, worsening symptoms->Disease progression on trial
Increased edema, worsening symptoms->Reports of cognitive changes
Multiple enhancing nodules, CSF dissemination->Palliative treatment attempt
WHO Grade III->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
WHO Grade III->Consider enrollment if eligible
Consider enrollment if eligible->Monitor for response
Consider enrollment if eligible->Disease progression on trial
WHO Grade II->Atypical features or subtotal resection
WHO Grade II->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
g.text: Recurrent or progressive despite local therapies

g.title: WHO Grade II->Check for TERT promoter mutation
Check for TERT promoter mutation->Inadequate symptom control
Check for TERT promoter mutation->Multiple recurrences, WHO Grade II-III
Incomplete (Simpson IV-V)->Atypical features or subtotal resection
Palliative treatment attempt->Disease progression on trial
